newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil - diesel still sought after.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil - diesel still sought after.

text.p: NWE gas oil had a quiet but firm start to the week with premiums for certain grades a touch easier, but largely offset by stronger futures.
May IPE gas oil was trading $1.00 a tonne stronger at $164.25 at 1100 GMT, primarily on the back of firmer NYMEX prices in overnight ACCESS trading.

Heating oil barge premiums were a touch easier, by 25-59 cents, with prompt Rotterdam refinery material offered at May IPE +75 cents to +$1 fob. Traders said spot demand was slow, with interest into Germany particularly weak.
Diesel barge premiums were steady with a small parcel of Rotterdam refinery material heard done in the morning at May IPE +$10 fob. Product remains tight.
"I have only heard Antwerp offered at May IPE +$9-9.50," said one barge trader.
Cargo premiums were broadly steady, although there was talk of easing numbers for FOD, the market for which has been very quiet.

Dealers said DIN was heard bid May IPE +$3 cif NWE with offers hovering around the $4.50 level. "FOD has been slow, but still notionally stronger than DIN so its probably around May IPE +$4-5," said one trader at a major.
EN590 was the grade the market was looking for and premiums were seen around May IPE +$10.50 cif NWE, a touch easier than last week.
"That may just be a Monday thing, because the fundamentals have not changed over the weekend," said one dealer.
